text: {{Infobox settlement |official_name = Cordillera Administrative Region |other_name = CAR |settlement_type = Region |image_skyline = |image_alt = |image_caption = |image_flag = |flag_size = 120x80px |image_seal = |seal_size = 100x80px |image_map = |map_caption = Location in the Philippines |nickname = |motto = |coordinates = |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = |subdivision_type1 = Island group |subdivision_name1 = Luzon |seat_type = Regional center |seat = Baguio |leader_title = |leader_name = |area_total_km2 = 19,422.03 |area_footnotes = |population_as_of = 2015 |population_total = 1,722,006 |population_footnotes = |population_density_km2 = auto |timezone = PST |utc_offset = +8 |iso_code = PH-15 |blank_name_sec1 = Provinces |blank_info_sec1 = |blank1_name_sec1 = Cities |blank1_info_sec1 = |blank2_name_sec1 = Municipalities |blank2_info_sec1 = 75 |blank3_name_sec1 = Barangays |blank3_info_sec1 = 1,176 |website = }} Cordillera Administrative Region is an administrative region in the Philippines. It is on the island of Luzon. The regional center is Baguio. It was created on July 15, 1987. There are 6 provinces: Abra, Apayao, Benguet, Ifugao, Kalinga and Mountain Province. Mount Pulag, the highest mountain in Luzon, is in the region. Rivers include the Chico River, Abulog, and Siffu River. Tourist sites include Banaue Rice Terraces, Cassamata Hill National Park, and Balbalasang-Balbalan National Park. ==References== Category:1980s establishments in the Philippines Category:1987 establishments in Asia
title: Cordillera Administrative Region
